Hi Jennifer,

I hope you are doing well

Thank you again for the thorough feedback—really appreciate it!

Just to confirm: yes, the PageSpeed results are typically lower in staging because indexing is turned off.

Once the site goes live, we’ll revisit the performance metrics and apply any final optimizations needed.

Let me know if you have any other questions or if there’s anything else we can assist with in the meantime!

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Allie Borcena

full_threads.body:
Hi Allie, Thanks for looking into this. Please see our findings below.
  • Homepage image: We've restored the original version and compressed it to improve load speed. If it still appears blurry on your end, feel free to send over a higher-res version and we'll be glad to update it.
    • It looks better. We can keep this one for now and we'll let you know if the client wants to update this in the future
  • Scrolling issue: We've disabled the custom "nice scroll" feature and reverted to the browser's default scroll behaviour, which should feel smoother and more responsive now.
    • This has improved, thanks.
  • Navigation speed: We're continuing to monitor this, but the latest PageSpeed results look promising.
    • As mentioned in the ticket for Oncobeta, the Pagespeed result is usually lower in staging since indexing is turned off on purpose. Can we confirm with them if that is the case here as well?
Regards, youname@combinate.me Support Manager P: 1300 247 018 • M: +63917 179 5366 11 Wilson Street, South Yarra VIC 3141 http://www.combinate.me/

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Manuel Lito Manceli

full_threads.body: Thank you guys! I appreciate you all 🙏
Hey @joel and @manuel can I get the time spent on this please

Hi Jennifer,

Thanks so much for the detailed feedback, really helpful.

Just a quick update on what we’ve adjusted:
  • Homepage image: We've restored the original version and compressed it to improve load speed. If it still appears blurry on your end, feel free to send over a higher-res version and we’ll be glad to update it.
  • Scrolling issue: We’ve disabled the custom "nice scroll" feature and reverted to the browser’s default scroll behavior, which should feel smoother and more responsive now.
  • Navigation speed: We’re continuing to monitor this, but the latest PageSpeed results look promising.

Here’s the updated staging link:
https://stg-commercialroaddentalsurgery-staging.kinsta.cloud/

Let us know how things look on your side or if you’d like us to swap in a sharper image. Always happy to help.

@allieB @manuel

Here's the updated version.
https://pagespeed.web.dev/analysis/https-stg-commercialroaddentalsurgery-staging-kinsta-cloud/sdamrnsz6z?form_factor=mobile

I've used the old image and tinified its size. If the client ask if its blurry, we can for better image.

For scroll, its seems to be a bit buggy so we have disabled the "nice scroll" settings then use the default browser scroll instead
Thanks @manuel Lance has sent a feedback through slack

@allieB Please check it.

Thank you for sharing your observations. We've reviewed each point and made updates accordingly. Please find our response below:

  1. Homepage Image
    Image Blurriness: We’ve replaced the homepage image with a higher-resolution version to improve visual clarity across devices and screen sizes. (Banner)
  2. Scrolling – Usability and Smoothness
    Improved Smoothness: We’ve added scroll-behavior: smooth where appropriate and ensured that overflow settings aren’t blocking vertical scroll events.
  3. Navigation Speed & Performance

Thank you for pointing this out. At this stage, our performance optimization work has only been applied to the homepage. The rest of the pages are still running on the original setup, which is why you may notice slower navigation or load times elsewhere.

Current Speed Performance
https://pagespeed.web.dev/analysis/https-stg-commercialroaddentalsurgery-staging-kinsta-cloud/387ee9gyfv?form_factor=mobile
